case_vignette: A 67-year-old-male farmer presents complaining of a growing mole on the right side of his cheek!   He states the mole was present for several years, but then started growing rapidly on one side a few weeks ago! Sometimes the mole will bleed on its own! He tries to avoid picking at the area!   Physical examination shows tan-brown ovoid irreuglarly shaped hyperpigmented macule with focal ulcearion! Dermoscopy demonstrates a blue-gray veil in the center of the lesion!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a mole on my cheek that has started growing rapidly on one side and sometimes it bleeds on its own.
Have you noticed any changes in color or shape of the mole recently?
Yes, the mole has changed in shape, becoming irregularly shaped, and it has developed a blue-gray area in the center.
How long have you noticed these changes occurring with your mole?
The changes started a few weeks ago.
Do you have a family history of skin cancer or any other kind of cancer?
I don't have any information about my family history of skin cancer or any other kind of cancer.
Are you currently on any medications, or have you been using any new skin products?
I haven't mentioned using any medications or new skin products.
Final Diagnosis: Malignant Melanoma
